pageContext.claim: “Democrats purposely misstated Medicaid under new Senate bill — actually goes up.”
pageContext.analysis: This is quite misleading. He describes the raw increase in Medicaid spending under the Senate bill. That is just one part of the picture that omits the fact that if the Senate bill as written by the date of his tweet becomes law, federal spending would be reduced by $772 billion over 10 years, according to the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office. Moreover, 15 million fewer people would be enrolled in the program over 10 years than would be under current law.
